post.body: "FIRE BAD!" Yeh. Frankenstein. But Dick CHOOSES to be there. So I get to make fun. When I have a stroke he can come kick my ass.
Wow, for $1500 it better do more than make coffee. I think Jura makes something lower end, Capresso Pro(?) For about $350.
Hope you enjoyed the Roots. How's that venue anyway? George Thorogood is playing there in a March. (Yeh I'm that old.)
You should be ok heading out. The snow squall should pass within the hour.
Sweet. I'm more accustomed to neighborhoods where a kid tries to sell you a car radio--which you later learn came from YOUR car.
I'm not going with Cec & T, so I'll be here. But they should be back by then as well.
I'm sentimental for Mavs. We had a '76 Mav 12 years ago. Not enough $$ to restore her so let her go. Ruby's a work in progress.
I really WANT to like the Killers--but can't get excited about them. They're like the Buzzcocks w/o the balls.
G'night tweets. Happy '09.
Happy New Year. Item one on my to-do list: stop writing 2008 on my checks. Yeh, that'll happen.
First person to hit Kellie Pickler in the face with a coal shovel gets a dollar.
Now channel surfing to see the horrific musical acts. Yummy.
Maybe they should just drop Dick Clark from that damn tower and be done with it. Did I mention New Years is not my favorite holiday?
F*ckhead that I am, I'm still awake waiting for that stupid ball to drop. Even tho I gotta be up early to go stand in the cold, with a cold.
Just back from a quick errand and can attest: the Bad Driving Olympics have officially begun.
Max&Ruby: Do you know what a surprise birthday party is? Me: It's like a regular birthday party except people hit you in the face. Surprise!
I think to cheer myself up, I'll get up at 6am, walk to the payphone up the street, and make random collect phone calls to hungover people.
Never a fan of New Years. Amateur drunks and clumsy adulterers crashing their cars and bodies into each other. And in the morning: regrets.
Had the 72 Ford out again today, before the weather got hinky. I think she appreciated the chance to stretch her legs, 2 days in row.
From the Shake Things Up Dept.: Next time you order fast food at a drive-thru, do it like you're James Brown singing Sex Machine.
